Directory Services for System Management

  • Directory-Enabled Networks DS definition:

    "A directory service is a physically distributed, logically centralized repository of infrequently changing data that is used to manage a computing environment."

    Not a new concept (Grapevine, StreetTalk), but a widespread urgent problem today.

  • System management is:

    maintaining and distributing structured, consistent data
       about managed objects:
          systems, services, accounts, groups, permissions, ...
    maintaining and expressing relationships between entities

  • LDAP provides:

    vendor-neutral relatively lightweight secure protocol;
    schema definition, occasionally standard;
    managed hierarchical (local) object space;
    standalone deployment model, with referrals;
